explanation: The report is correct. With OS_DEBUG defined as an empty macro the inner if (errno == EINVAL) { ... } becomes an evaluated condition with an empty body (no side-effects). At runtime the condition may be tested, but removing the whole if-statement (including the condition) would not change observable program behaviour, so that constitutes executed but redundant code (dead code) under MISRA C:2023 Rule 2.2. Note this depends on OS_DEBUG being empty; if OS_DEBUG produces code (or the condition has side-effects) then it would not be dead. Remedies include removing the empty if, guarding the diagnostics with preprocessor conditionals so the runtime test is also removed, or making OS_DEBUG expand to something that prevents the block from being a no-op.
